timings.name: Return to CRU for Treatment Period 2

conditions.name: ALT Elevation Criteria
conditions.description: Liver function test abnormality requiring dose modification
conditions.text: ALT > 3 × ULN accompanied by bilirubin > 2 × ULN indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening Criteria
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening Criteria
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis

conditions.name: SRC Safety Review Approval
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee approval for dose titration
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant

conditions.name: Age Eligibility
conditions.text: Male or female participants aged 18 to 65 years

conditions.name: Wilson Disease Diagnosis
conditions.text: Documented diagnosis of WD by Leipzig score ≥ 4

conditions.name: Renal Function Criteria
conditions.text: Creatinine clearance ≥ 30 mL/min, not on dialysis

transitionRules.name: Run-in to Treatment Period 1
transitionRules.text: Following screening and enrollment, participants will have a Run-in Period to support diet equilibration (Day -7 through Day -5) and measurement of pretreatment copper and molybdenum balance (Day -4 through Day -1)

transitionRules.name: 15mg to 30mg Dose Titration
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29 through Day 39

transitionRules.name: ALT Elevation Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: ALT > 3 × ULN: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Hemoglobin Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Hemoglobin > 20% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Platelet Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Platelets > 25% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Neutrophil Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Bilirubin Elevation Temporary Interruption
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN: Temporary interruption with weekly repeat testing

transitionRules.name: Serious Hypersensitivity Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs

transitionRules.name: Severe Infection Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if severe uncontrolled infection occurs

transitionRules.name: Disallowed Medication Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if use of disallowed medication occurs

transitionRules.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs

transitionRules.name: Inpatient to Outpatient Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants may be discharged from the CRU on Day 9 to return on Day 22 or Day 23

transitionRules.name: Outpatient to Inpatient Period 2
transitionRules.text: Participants will be re-admitted on Day 22 or Day 23 for Treatment Period 2 and will remain in house until Day 40

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when parameters return to baseline. A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed

transitionRules.name: Post-Study Therapy Transition
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods (Day 40), participants will transition to therapy that was discontinued before enrollment, or transition to other standard of care therapy, or consider continuation of ALXN1840 treatment

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Voluntary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after 3 telephone calls and certified letter

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Intervention Discontinuation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: If the study intervention is definitively discontinued, the participant should remain in the study to be evaluated for safety follow-up

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: SRC Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Safety Review Committee reviews available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: ALT Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose reduction or interruption based on ALT elevation

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Hematology Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose reduction based on hemoglobin, platelet, or neutrophil decreases

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Neurological Assessment Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor evaluate need for dose modification based on neurologic worsening

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Psychiatric Assessment Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor evaluate need for dose modification based on psychiatric worsening

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period Extension Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator approval required to extend Outpatient Period up to an additional 14 days

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: CRU Retention Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At the CRU's discretion, participants may remain in the CRU during the outpatient period for safety or to maintain the integrity of the conduct of the study

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Rechallenge Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to rechallenge after dose interruption when parameters return to baseline, maximum 3 rechallenges allowed
